title: Senator James McGrath posts photo of a dead cockatoo trapped under his car's roof rack
text:
A senator sparked outrage by callously posting photo of a dead cockatoo wedged under his roof rack after he drove through a flock.

James McGrath, senator for Queensland, hit the popular native bird on Saturday with his only comment on its demise being 'car 1, flock of cockatoos 0'.

The Liberal National politician was immediately condemned by conservationists, bird lovers, and ordinary voters for his apparently lack of concern.

Senator James McGrath sparked outrage by callously posting photo of a dead cockatoo wedged under his roof rack after he drove through a flock

Senator McGrath, whose idea of a good insult is 'Australia rocks, you don't' in reference to former PM Julia Gillard's concerns about an Australia-UK free trade agreement, got plenty of better ones lobbed his way.

'This has done nothing but highlight your immaturity, lack of empathy and lack of common decency,' one wrote.

'This photo, and yourself for taking and posting it, are disgraceful. You are not someone I would want making mature decisions in any capacity.'

Another wrote: 'This photo shows me the utter disrespect you must have for our Australian wildlife that you could accidentally kill this bird and then leave the bird's poor body in place to take photos and laugh about it.'

Senator McGrath was immediately condemned by conservationists, bird lovers, and ordinary voters for his apparently lack of concern

A third wrote: 'Grow up, and act like you deserve to be a representative for the people of your electorate and state.'

Senator McGrath didn't appear phased by the hundreds of comments with near universal backlash and never responded to any.

He instead made a snarky comment in reaction the former Labor leader Bill Shorten acknowledging his party's election defeat was his fault.

'As Chairman of the Bill Shorten Appreciation Society, I approve,' he wrote.
description: James McGrath, senator for Queensland, hit the popular native bird on Saturday with his only comment on its demise being 'car 1, flock of cockatoos 0'. He was immediately condemned.
authors: Nic White For Daily Mail Australia
